lines.text: Using the utility knife, cut the tennis ball in half.  Be careful doing this, as tennis balls are not easy to cut.
lines.text_raw: Using the utility knife, cut the tennis ball in half.  Be careful doing this, as tennis balls are not easy to cut.

lines.text: Rotate the ball halves so the open ends are facing away from each other.  Depending on how you want the holder to look, you can line them up evenly or you can angle them for a more interesting look.  Don’t angle them too much, or the holder won’t be able to hold anything.
lines.text_raw: Rotate the ball halves so the open ends are facing away from each other.  Depending on how you want the holder to look, you can line them up evenly or you can angle them for a more interesting look.  Don’t angle them too much, or the holder won’t be able to hold anything.

lines.text: Use superglue to glue the two halves together at the angle you’ve chosen.
lines.text_raw: Use superglue to glue the two halves together at the angle you’ve chosen.

lines.text: Your creation can now be used to hold rings, pennies, paper clips, or any other random object you have lying around.

guide.summary: Reuse an old tennis ball to hold small items around the house.
guide.title: Tennis Ball Random Goods Holder
